title: Stocks to Watch as the “Stay-At-Home” Trend Continues
text: Google (NASDAQ:GOOGL) recently joined the list of growing companies to postpone their back-to-work plans as the Covid-19 delta variant continues to spread.   Along with Google, Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has previously extended working from home for the same reason.

title: Facebook doubles profit but braces for hit from Apple privacy changes

title: Facebook warns of ‘headwinds' to its ad business from regulators and Apple
text: Facebook posted its second quarter earnings Wednesday, beating expectations with $29 billion in revenue. The world's biggest social media company was expected to report $27.8 billion in revenue for the quarter, a 50 percent increase from the same period in 2020.

title: Apple will require masks in many U.S. stores regardless of vaccination status
text: Apple gained a reputation during the Covid-19 pandemic for making evidence-based decisions about where and when it was safe to operate its retail stores.

title: Which giant tech stock should you buy in Q3? Apple, Alphabet, or Microsoft?
text: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG), Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), and Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) all reported Q2 results on Tuesday after markets closed. The three technology giants beat analyst expectations on revenue and earnings, sparking an after-hours surge in the stock prices.

title: Why the Dow Jones Is Falling Today Despite Great Earnings From Apple, Boeing, Microsoft, Visa
text: A great report for Boeing has its shares soaring, but worries about future growth from the tech giants has most of the Dow Jones stocks -- and many other U.S. issues -- falling.

title: Should you buy Apple shares after blowout Q3 results? This analyst thinks so

title: Apple Crushes Earnings Once Again
text: Apple, Inc. ( AAPL , Financial) reported impressive fiscal third-quarter results on July 27, exceeding the revenue and earnings expectations of analysts. The company reported earnings per share of $1.30 against analyst expectations of $1 per share.

title: 2 FAANG Stocks Flooded With Bull Notes After Earnings

title: Apple, Google and Microsoft all upgraded after bumper earnings
text: Tech giants Google owner Alphabet Inc, Microsoft Corporation, and Apple Inc all received hefty price upgrades today after all the trio announced bumper earnings last night. UBS raised its target on Alphabet to US$3,190 from US$2,600 compared to a current share price of US$2,638 after what the broker said overall were positive second-quarter numbers.

title: Apple Drops, Google Pops, and the Stock Market Is Waiting for the Fed
text: Stocks were set for muted gains as investors wait for an update from the Federal Reserve later Wednesday.

title: Analysis-Apple, AMD navigate chip shortage with focus on profitable products
text: The global chip shortage has grounded major automotive factories to a halt but pushed technology giants to become more flexible by diverting existing supplies to their most profitable products, analysts and executives said.
